intro: Matelea schreiteri, commonly known as the Schreiter's mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Matelea schreiteri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
